ANIPLUS x hololive production Collaboration Cafe Opens in Korea From May 1st, 2025
item.author: Horii
item.content:encoded: COVER Corporation (Minato-ku, Tokyo; CEO: Tanigo Motoaki) has announced that hololive production x ANIPLUS collaboration cafe will be opened in Korea for a limited period starting from May 1st, 2025.The collaboration caf√© theme was previously held in the ANIPLUS caf√© in Singapore and will be revived in the ANIPLUS caf√© in Korea. The collaboration cafe will feature a collaboration menu featuring Shirakami Fubuki, Ookami Mio, Nekomata Okayu, and Inugami Korone from hololive‚Äôs unit ‚Äúhololive GAMERS‚Äù and the members of hololive 3rd generation, Usada Pekora, Shiranui Flare, Shirogane Noel, and Houshou Marine. Attendees who order the collaboration menu will receive exclusive items. In addition, hololive production x ANIPLUS collaboration caf√© collaboration merch will be released.ANIPLUS x hololive production Caf√© May 1st ‚Äì June 29th B101, Mapo Hangang PRUGIO 2nd apt. Arcade, 14 World Cup-ro 3-gil, Mapo-gu, Seoul, Republic of Korea May 1st ‚Äì June 29th 9F, 672, Jungang-daero, Busanjin-gu, Busan, Republic of Korea May 1st ‚Äì May 28th 401~403, Cheongjeong-Building, 126, Jungang-ro, Jung-gu, Daejeon, Republic of Korea May 1st ‚Äì June 29th 12, Chungjangnoan-gil, Dong-gu, Gwangju, Republic of KoreaANIPLUS x hololive production Caf√© Menu Limited Bonus for the 1st to 4th Week: Coaster & Mini holder (Random) *Limited bonus for the 5th week and onwards will be announced at a later date.ANIPLUS x hololive production Caf√© Merchhololive production x ANIPLUS Caf√© Merch Bonus With 20,000 KRW spent on hololive production merchandise: Sticker (random) With 50,000 KRW spent on hololive production merchandise: Hologram Ticket (random) With 70,000 KRW spent on hololive production merchandise: Transparent fan (random)*Designs distributed randomly. *All premiums are available while stocks last only.

item.title: From Newcomer to Manager of 100 Million Yen-Level Live Events: What is the Appeal of Arena-Level Project Management?
item.author: cover_yamaguchi
item.content:encoded: Well, I am in a position where I can lead arena-scale live events and projects worth hundreds of millions of yen. I don‚Äôt think there are many opportunities to be so deeply involved in projects of this scale in your 20s. Because COVER and this business are still in a growing phase, everyone‚Äôs responsibilities are not fixed, allowing those with ambition to gain experience in a wide range of fields.It‚Äôs a bit of a cliche, but the sense of accomplishment is also one of its appeals. Live event productions span long periods and involve many challenges. Still, when the event day arrives, and I see the fans‚Äô enthusiasm, I sincerely appreciate the hard work I have put in when I see their smiles. When I spy fans who are happy to be holding merch from a live event that I was involved in, I want to tell them, ‚ÄúI made those!‚Äù (lol)In addition to making proposals for live productions, another key role of a Live Events PM is to make decisions on the details to move the event forward, so I also find it rewarding to be able to manage projects with a certain degree of decision-making authority.

item.title: A New Space for Fans to Connect. Our Boots-on-the-Ground Report from hololive OFFICIAL CARD GAME‚Äôs First Major Event: ‚ÄúWorld Grand Prix 2025‚Äù
item.author: cover_yamaguchi
item.content:encoded: hololive OFFICIAL CARD GAME debuted in the rapidly growing TCG marketThe TCG market has been growing rapidly in recent years. According to a study by The Japan Toy Association*1, the domestic TCG market roughly doubled in size in just two years, from 122.2 billion yen in fiscal 2020 to 234.9 billion yen in fiscal 2022. The market is also projected to grow on a global scale.Amid this market environment, the ‚Äúhololive OFFICIAL CARD GAME‚Äù(commonly known as hOCG), that debuted in September 2024, is attracting attention as a new form of TCG that utilizes VTuber IP. This work is built around the concept of ‚Äúcreating and competing together¬†with fans,‚Äù offering a unique world where players can relive their activities in support of hololive through a card game experience. Players select their favorite hololive member, known as their ‚Äúoshi holo member,‚Äù and develop the game by producing stages for them.The card designs are also very elaborate, and even the same card may have a VTuber‚Äôs autograph printed on it, or there may be a ‚Äúparallel‚Äù version with special processing, making it a very collectible item. The game‚Äôs achievement of both gameplay and collectability makes it appealing for both TCG and hololive fans alike. After the game was released, card shops across Japan began holding periodic how-to-play classes and tournaments, creating an environment where players of all skill levels, from beginners to experts, could enjoy the game in their play styles.A report from the day of the World Grand Prix 2025, the first large-scale event for hOCGAt the World Grand Prix 2025 event held at Makuhari Messe on January 18, 2025, the main event was the WGP 2025 Main Tournament where players competed for the right to participate in the National Championship, and there were also a variety of other tournaments tailored to the needs of players, such as the easy-to-join eight-player ‚ÄúCasual Tournament‚Äù and the large-scale individual battle ‚ÄúBloom Cup DX,‚Äù letting players enjoy hOCG throughout the day.From early in the morning, many participants gathered at the venue, and participants with various objectives came to the venue, including those who sat down at tables and began preparing for the tournament as soon as the doors opened, those who visited the exhibition area to look at and photograph the exhibits, and those who went to the merchandise corner.The opening ceremony was held at 10:00 AM, with CEO Motoaki Tanigo taking the stage to deliver the opening address, while hololive member Hakui Koyori appeared in a video declaring the event open. The venue erupted with a thunderous surprise at the unexpected guest.While the matches in the WGP 2025 Main Tournament that started in the morning were progressing smoothly, the Casual Tournament, which started at 12:00 PM, was held in the form of an eight-person team mini-tournament that also allowed people to participate on the day, and registration was accepted at any time until 6:30 PM in response to needs such as participating in a low-key manner as well as with friends.In the afternoon, the large-scale individual competition, the Bloom Cup DX, began. At this tournament, the plan was designed to improve players‚Äô motivation to win, so the prizes became more and more luxurious as players advanced through the rounds.In the evening, the WGP 2025 Main Tournament progressed to the semi-finals and finals. As the heated battles unfolded, there were many participants quietly watching the battles from the sidelines.There are other ways to enjoy the event besides competing. Creating a venue that only hOCG could deliver and brief details of prizes wonIn addition to banners of hololive production-affiliated VTubers lining the venue, a life-size figure of Usada Pekora was on display near the entrance. This created a space where one could be fully immersed in the world of hololive.In the exhibition area, people who had finished playing or were taking a break were seen taking photos of the banners and display cards as well as enjoying chatting with other participants. In addition, cards and related products were sold in the merchandise corner, where many popular items sold out early in the day.As a special bonus for participating in the event, all participants received a ‚ÄúSuper PR Pack vol. 1‚Äù (containing one randomly selected card from a total of 10 different types), and the players who made it through to the finals were given cards with special illustrations and specifications depending on their placings.In addition to the commemorative plaque, the winners and runners-up of the WGP 2025 Main Tournament qualified for the next goal, the ‚ÄúExtremer Cup National Finals.‚ÄùBecoming new touchpoints for hololive fans. A new community brought together by hOCG, as attested by the voices of participantsThe World Grand Prix 2025, hOCG‚Äôs first large-scale event, attracted a diverse range of participants from all over the country, from TCG novices to veteran players. While heated battles were being waged across the tables, in between matches, people could be seen excitedly talking about their oshi (favorites members). From participants‚Äô feedback, we will introduce the new connections that were formed through hOCG.A man in his 20s from Miyagi Prefecture told us, ‚ÄúMy encounter with Sui-chan‚Äôs (Hoshimachi Suisei) songs was the trigger that drew me more and more into the charms of hololive.‚Äù A female fan of Amane Kanata, who was playing card games with him, commented, ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt play TCG before, but I gradually started to join local tournaments,‚Äù while the male fan, talking about the unique fun of hOCG, enthusiastically stated, ‚ÄúThe passion I had for TCG before was completely rekindled by hOCG. The appeal of hOCG is that you can fight using cards your oshi!‚ÄùA party of seven men from Aichi Prefecture noted they all met through hOCG, and commented, ‚ÄúIn our local community, we enjoy ourselves together across generations with players in their teens to through the 60s.‚Äù Among them, one told us, ‚ÄúEncountering hololive made me want to spread online communities and VTubers more, and in the future, I hope to work in social media marketing. I am currently studying for that.‚Äù This person found his future passion through hololive.Two men who participated after arriving the day before the event from Nagoya brought their own custom character bags and commented, ‚ÄúWe originally played TCGs, but what‚Äôs unique about hOCG is that the decks are divided, and most importantly, it‚Äôs fun to use cards of my oshi members,‚Äù sharing the fans‚Äô perspective on hOCG‚Äôs appeal.¬†A pair of men from Shizuoka Prefecture remarked they met each other through hOCG. One told us, ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been away from TCGs for a while, but I remembered how fun TCGs are when I played with my oshi‚Äôs card in hOCG.‚Äù His friend also stated with a smile, ‚ÄúI usually watch streams alone, so I couldn‚Äôt interact with anyone, but I‚Äôm glad I made friends with like-minded people to invite to live events through this game.‚ÄùFrom another group of seven people who connected through social media and were meeting face-to-face for the first time that day, one explained, ‚ÄúMaybe it‚Äôs because hololive fans are gathering, but even though it‚Äôs a TCG tournament, there‚Äôs no tense atmosphere.‚Äù Another added, ‚ÄúDuring the breaks between matches, we can get excited talking about our oshis, like, ‚ÄòThis one is so cute!‚Äô I think that‚Äôs what makes hOCG tournaments unique.‚Äù We also heard comments such as, ‚ÄúWhen you see someone‚Äôs deck case or playmat and say, ‚ÄòOh, we have the same oshi!‚Äô‚Äîthat‚Äôs how conversations start.‚Äù This shows how the combination of VTubers x TCG is creating new touchpoints among hololive fans.There was also feedback along the lines of, ‚ÄúThis card got me interested in the ‚Äòhololive English‚Äô stars, and I started watching English-language VTuber broadcasts too.‚Äù There were also many participants who were captivated by the fun of the competition, saying, ‚ÄúI‚Äôve set a new goal of aiming to compete in the National Championship.‚ÄùThis year‚Äôs World Grand Prix 2025 also attracted visitors from outside Japan, and we also spoke to a pair of exchange students from Italy and the United States who shared, ‚ÄúWe met on Discord for overseas fans and got together for this event.‚Äù They decided to participate after seeing an ad for the event on a social media site, and are enjoying cross-border interactions through hOCG. It was impressive to see how communication that transcended language barriers was created naturally through the common language of TCG.Asking the producer about how the tournament went and new potential of hOCGWe spoke with Mr. Kawatsu, product and event producer at Bushiroad Inc., which handles the operations for hOCG events, about the participant demographics at the tournament. Analyzing the growth in new players entering the TCG scene through hOCG, he explained, ‚ÄúAccording to data from Bushi Navi,* more than half of the participants created a new account on the platform after mid-July 2024, when registration opened for the classes on how to play hOCG.‚Äù¬†When asked about the measures that are unique to hololive in terms of event management, Mr. Kawatsu explained, ‚ÄúThe venue announcements made by the affiliated VTubers are one of the unique elements of hololive, and it is a special experience that you cannot get at other TCG events.‚Äù He added, ‚ÄúIn the Bloom Cup DX, we focused on table numbers and rankings by adopting a format in which special awards are given to players whose table numbers correspond to the numbers associated with affiliated VTubers.‚Äù He also shared some of the unique developments underway, noting, ‚ÄúThis scheme has been well received by hololive fans, and it is spreading, with some users even incorporating similar measures into their own events.‚ÄùAt the World Grand Prix Tokyo tournament to be held in May, a Casual Tournament called the ‚ÄúOshi Holomem‚Äôs Cup‚Äù is planned, which will provide a venue where players with the same oshi holo members can compete against each other. He also shared what‚Äôs ahead, saying, ‚ÄúThe image we have is that hOCG events are like amusement parks. We aim to create a place where various attractions are prepared and where visitors can enjoy them in their own ways.‚ÄùMr. Kawatsu closed our conversation by expressing his enthusiasm, ‚ÄúI think the value of hOCG events lies in the fact that they bring people together through the likes of hololive and TCG. By creating a better environment through the combined efforts of the players, the store staff, and our management team, I want to create a place where people will naturally say things like, ‚ÄòLet‚Äôs meet again at a hOCG event!‚Äô and ‚ÄòLet‚Äôs go to a hololive event next time!'‚ÄùMr. Horie, Manager and Producer of the Card Business Development Office at COVER Corp., shared his feelings and views on hOCG‚Äôs potential after the event: ‚ÄúI can sum my feelings in one word: gratitude. The fact that we were able to host a tournament with approximately 2,700 participants in just four short months since the release of hOCG is entirely thanks to the love and support shown for the cards. Leading up to the event, I saw users actively engaging with one another on social media, and at the venue, I witnessed real-life interactions taking place everywhere. This was exactly what we had dreamed of when we first launched hOCG, and now that it has become a reality, I find myself at a loss for words to fully express the joy and gratitude I feel.‚Äù¬†He explained the intent behind each event when holding this tournament: ‚ÄúOur hope was for participants to experience the excitement of realizing, ‚ÄòThere are so many others who share my interests!‚Äô and to connect with one another by sharing that passion. To achieve this, we organized three key events: the WGP 2025 Main Tournament, where players compete for a spot in the National Championship; the Bloom Cup DX, a one-day competition where participants can win luxurious prizes as they advance through the rounds; and the Casual Tournament, designed to encourage friendly matches and interactions among attendees.‚ÄùLooking ahead, he added, ‚ÄúWhile tournaments naturally involve intense competition and not every moment is relaxed, our ultimate goal has always been to create an experience where participants leave with smiles on their faces, eager to join another hOCG event and engage with even more players. We‚Äôve carefully planned each aspect of this tournament with that in mind. I want to continue to cherish the connections and enjoyment that are born through hOCG. I hope that through these events, people will continue to feel the presence of the hOCG community,‚Äù articulated Mr. Horie.A new future of entertainment drawn out by hololive x TCGAt the World Grand Prix 2025, we witnessed a new card game culture emerging that seamlessly blends digital and analog experiences. Participants were not only fully immersed in intense matches but also enthusiastically sharing stories about their oshi, while the crowd erupted with excitement at venue announcements made by hololive production-affiliated VTubers.This event has brought people together from all over Japan, including Aichi and Miyagi prefectures, welcoming players regardless of age or experience. Starting with a shared interest of oshi hololive members, the bonds that deepen through card games presented a new way of enjoying VTuber content.The unique worldview and community that has been created through the fusion of the digital existence known as VTubers and TCG gaming has given us a glimpse of new possibilities and developments in the entertainment industry.Stay tuned for more reports from COVERedge on the events that COVER is engaged in.

item.title: COVER Corporation Announces hololive Meet 2025 Ambassadors
item.author: Horii
item.content:encoded: COVER Corporation announced today the five new Ambassadors for hololive Meet 2025.Momosuzu Nene (hololive), Vestia Zeta (hololive Indonesia), Koseki Bijou (hololive English), Otonose Kanade (hololive DEV_IS), Aragami Oga (HOLOSTARS), and Octavio (HOLOSTARS English) have been appointed as hololive Meet 2025 Ambassadors, where they will be actively promoting ongoing and upcoming hololive Meet projects. There will be release of new merchandise featuring the newly appointed Ambassadors at a future date!Comments from hololive Meet 2025 Ambassadors ‚ÄúKonNene! hololive 5th generation! The ‚ÄúN‚Äù in NePoLaBo, the energy drink for everyone‚Äôs hearts! I‚Äôm Momosuzu Nene! Is everyone doing well?! Thank you always for your support!üíõ Thanks to everyone, I was chosen as an ambassador for 2025!‚ú® It‚Äôs all thanks to the passionate support from my overseas husbands! Let‚Äôs go and see more and more different sceneries from here on out! Nene is going to do her best to make all the Nekkos around the world happy!‚ÄùVestia Zeta (hololive Indonesia) ‚ÄúAaa mission stato! Halooo, I‚Äôm Vestia Zeta from hololive Indonesia gen 3! I just got a new mission to become the Hololive Meet Ambassador 2025! Super excited to create amazing memories with you all! We do a little meeting! SEE YOUUU! Yoroshiku ne!‚ÄùKoseki Bijou (hololive English) ‚ÄúKIRA KIRA~ KOSEKI!!! I‚Äôm Koseki Bijou (BIBOO!) and TODAYYYYY I‚Äôm happy to say that I‚Äôm an ambassador this year for hololive Meet 2025!! HELLO EVERYONE FROM ALL OVER THE WORLD!!! I‚Äôm so grateful for this opportunity and I can‚Äôt wait to meet you! Get ready cuz I‚Äôm taking my Biboo love to you!! IT‚ÄôS TIME TO ROCK THE BEEP IN! :D!‚ÄùOtonose Kanade (hololive DEV_IS) ‚ÄúDo-Re-Mi-Fa-So-La-Si-Do! I am Otonose Kanade, an aspiring musician from hololive DEV_IS ReGLOSS! Woo! I‚Äôm an ambassador for hololive Meet 2025! Thank you to everyone around the world for supporting hololive!‚ú® I‚Äôll do my best to make lots of fun memories! Spread your wings and fly out into the world, hololive!‚Äù ‚ÄúHey, how are you doing? I‚Äôm Aragami Oga from HOLOSTARS! Thanks to all of you from all over the world for your support! Now that I‚Äôve been chosen as an ambassador for hololive Meet 2025, I‚Äôll do my best to make all the fans around the world happy so yoroshiku!‚ÄùOctavio (HOLOSTARS ENGLISH) ‚ÄúIt is I! The one whose name starts with an O and ends with an O, my name is Octavio from Holostars English! It is my pleasure to show you around all of our Holomeet events this year. Just make sure you step out of the way when I ambassador here, and ambassador there and ambassador all over the place though! I‚Äôm looking forward to you meeting me as well! Time for me to ambassador out of here! See you when I see you!‚Äù

item.content:encoded: „Éõ„É≠„É©„Ç§„ÉñÊâÄÂ±û„Äå‰∏ÉË©©„É†„É°„Ç§„Äç„Åï„Çì„ÅÆÂçíÊ•≠„ÅåÁô∫Ë°®„Åï„Çå„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ„Åì„Çå„Å´‰º¥„ÅÑ„ÄÅ‰∏ÉË©©„É†„É°„Ç§„Åï„Çì„ÅåÂèÇÂä†„Åô„Çã„Ç∞„ÉÉ„Ç∫„ÇÑ‰ΩúÂìÅ„ÅÆË≤©Â£≤Áä∂Ê≥Å„Çí„Åæ„Å®„ÇÅ„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ‰ªäÂõû„ÅØ„ÄåÂçíÊ•≠„ÄçÊâ±„ÅÑ„Å®„Å™„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇÁèæÂú®Áô∫Â£≤‰∏≠„ÅÆ„Ç∞„ÉÉ„Ç∫„ÇÑ„Éú„Ç§„Çπ„ÅØË≤©Â£≤„ÅåÂÅúÊ≠¢„Åï„Çå„ÇãÂèØËÉΩÊÄß„ÅåÈ´ò„ÅÑ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ„Åæ„Åü‰ªäÂæåÁô∫Â£≤‰∫àÂÆö„Å†„Å£„Åü„ÇÇ„ÅÆ„ÇÇÈñãÁô∫‰∏≠Ê≠¢„Å´„Å™„ÇãÂ†¥Âêà„ÇÇ„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ‚óèÁèæÂú®Ë≥ºÂÖ•„Åß„Åç„ÇãÂèØËÉΩÊÄß„Åå„ÅÇ„Çã„ÇÇ„ÅÆ„ÅÆ„ÅøÊé≤Ëºâ„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ‚óèÊé≤ËºâÂÜÖÂÆπ„ÅØ‰∫àÂëä„Å™„ÅèÂ§âÊõ¥„ÉªË≤©Â£≤ÁµÇ‰∫Ü„Åï„Çå„ÇãÂ†¥Âêà„Åå„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ„Åì„Å°„Çâ„Åã„Çâ„ÅîÈÄ£Áµ°„ÅÑ„Åü„Å†„Åë„Çã„Å®Âä©„Åã„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇÔ∏éË≤©Â£≤ÊúüÈñìÔºö„Äú25Âπ¥4Êúà28Êó•18:00„Éª„Å≠„Çì„Å©„Çç„ÅÑ„Å©ÔºàÂéüÂûãË¶ãÊú¨ÂÖ¨ÈñãÊ∏à„Åø„Åß„Åô„ÅåÁô∫Â£≤„Åó„Å™„ÅÑÂ†¥Âêà„ÅÇ„ÇäÔºâhololive official shop „Ç∞„ÉÉ„Ç∫„Éª„Éú„Ç§„ÇπÔ∏éË≤©Â£≤ÊúüÈñì„Éú„Ç§„ÇπÔºö„Äú25Âπ¥4Êúà28Êó•23:59„Åæ„ÅßÔºàÂ£≤„ÇäÂàá„Çå„Å¶„ÇÇÂú®Â∫´„ÅåÂæ©Ê¥ª„Åô„ÇãÂèØËÉΩÊÄß„Åå„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„ÅôÔºâÔ∏éË≤©Â£≤ÊúüÈñìÔºö25Âπ¥4Êúà28Êó•(Êúà)23:59„Åæ„ÅßÔºüÔºàÊ≠£Âºè„Å™Ë≤©Â£≤ÊúüÈñì„ÅØÁô∫Ë°®„Åï„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åõ„ÇìÔºâÔºà„Ç∞„É´„Éº„Éó„Åß„ÅÆÂïÜÂìÅ„ÅØË≤©Â£≤ÂÅúÊ≠¢„Åó„Å™„ÅÑÂèØËÉΩÊÄß„Åå„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„ÅôÔºâhololive OFFICIAL CARD GAME

item.title: Virtual idols, real fans: Hololive‚Äôs bet on the future of pop - The Japan Times
Outside Director Kimiyuki Suda Unravels COVER‚Äôs Growth Journey and Future Challenges Build on Relationship of Trust Spanning 20 Years
item.author: cover_hirata
item.content:encoded: When COVER was founded in 2016, it was developing a VR table tennis game in a modest multi-tenant building in Shibuya. After that, I also watched in real time as the Company shifted its focus to the VTuber business. At first, COVER didn‚Äôt have a clear direction, but as it continued its research into voice apps and surveyed illustrators, and with the backdrop of the emergence of Kizuna AI‚Äîthe world‚Äôs first virtual YouTuber‚Äîthe pieces gradually came together.A major turning point for the Company was when Mr. Tanigo spoke at the Infinity Ventures Summit (IVS) held in December 2017. His presentation at IVS was the trigger for spreading the COVER name in the startup community. Until then, it had been difficult to gain the understanding of investors regarding the VTuber business, but the situation flipped after the presentation at IVS, and COVER received many offers for funding on the same day.My most memorable touchpoint with COVER‚Äôs fans was the first concert held by hololive production at Toyosu PIT. At the time, I was somewhat skeptical about holding the concert, but I was blown away by the excitement of the audience waving their glow sticks at the venue.During the event, there was a technical glitch that caused the concert to be temporarily interrupted. A prolonged silence during a concert is quite a mess, isn‚Äôt it? After a while, people here and there in the audience started to shout encouragement along the lines of ‚ÄúYou got this!!‚Äù (aimed at the concert organizers)¬† Then, someone shouted ‚ÄúYAGOO (CEO Tanigo‚Äôs nickname), You got this!‚Äù, and before we knew it, the whole auditorium transformed into a frenzied chorus of ‚ÄúYAGOO! YAGOO!‚Äù¬† ¬† I got goosebumps from the sense of unity at that moment. After that, hololive production grew steadily as a business including its global expansion. Looking back, the road to listing seems to have been relatively smooth, but in reality the problems were endless (lol). My impression is that the Company has grown through a variety of experiences, including these kinds of problems. I also believe the presence of rivals in the industry has been a positive for market growth.

item.title: Octopus x hololive Gen 0 Virtual Cards are Available from March 14th - „Ç´„Éê„ÉºÊ†™Âºè‰ºöÁ§æ
Octopus x hololive Gen 0 Virtual Cards are Available from March 14th - „Éõ„É≠„É©„Ç§„ÉñÂÖ¨Âºè„Çµ„Ç§„Éà
Octopus x hololive Gen 0 Virtual Cards are Available from March 14th
item.author: Horii
item.content:encoded: COVER Corporation has announced a new collaboration between hololive production and Octopus Card, introducing exclusive virtual card images featuring hololive Gen 0 talents. These special edition Octopus Card images are available for purchase through the ‚ÄúOctopus Card Image Store‚Äù.As one of the most widely used smart payment systems in Hong Kong, Octopus Card will release a set of five unique virtual card images featuring Tokino Sora, Roboco-san, AZKi, Sakura Miko, and Hoshimachi Suisei. Each design features the talents in traditional Hong Kong style outfits, enjoying iconic local street food and embracing the city‚Äôs vibrant culture.The hololive Gen 0 virtual card images will be available exclusively on the ‚ÄúOctopus Card Image Store‚Äù starting from March 14th, 2025 at HK$38 each.During the sales period, all fans who purchase the card will automatically qualify for a giveaway event. Stay tuned to Octopus‚Äô official social media channels for details on entry requirements and giveaway announcements.For more information, please visit the official Octopus social media accounts. Octopus is a contactless stored value card that provides customers with a simple, safe, and secure way to pay. First launched in 1997 across public transport systems, the applications of the Octopus card have since expanded to include retail stores and various facilities, making everyday life more convenient.

item.title: hololive performs at the Final Act of ‚ÄúENTRY Inc. presents Japan Expo Paris in Osaka 2025‚Äù at the Osaka-Kansai Expo! | NEWS | hololive official website - „Éõ„É≠„É©„Ç§„ÉñÂÖ¨Âºè„Çµ„Ç§„Éà
hololive performs at the Final Act of ‚ÄúENTRY Inc. presents Japan Expo Paris in Osaka 2025‚Äù at the Osaka-Kansai Expo!
item.author: maki
item.content:encoded: COVER Corp., the company behind the VTuber agency ‚Äúhololive production,‚Äù is pleased to announce that hololive will perform at ‚ÄúENTRY Inc. presents Japan Expo Paris in Osaka 2025,‚Äù held at the Osaka-Kansai Expo on April 26th (Sat) and 27th (Sun), 2025.Confirmed as the Final Act for ‚ÄúENTRY Inc. presents Japan Expo Paris in Osaka 2025‚Äù!Talents from hololive, hololive Indonesia, and hololive English will come together for a special showcase during the ‚Äú2nd part‚Äù on April 27th at the EXPO Arena of the Osaka-Kansai Expo. This will be a one-night-only performance that you won‚Äôt want to miss! To attend, advance reservations are required through the official Osaka-Kansai Expo website. The ‚Äú2nd part‚Äù performance will be available through a lottery system, and applications must be submitted via the Expo‚Äôs official website up to 8 days before the event. Don‚Äôt miss this special opportunity! We look forward to your applications. Hoshimachi Suisei, Sakura Miko, Nakiri Ayame, Oozora Subaru, Usada Pekora, Shirogane Noel, Houshou Marine, Amane Kanata, Tsunomaki Watame, Kobo Kanaeru, Mori Calliope, Shiori Novella, Koseki Bijou, Nerissa Ravencroft, Fuwawa Abyssgard, Mococo Abyssgard.Note: Performers are subject to change without notice.Japan Expo Paris in Osaka Information

item.title: Nijisanji and Hololive Will Play a Collab Baseball Game - Siliconera
What‚Äôs Ahead for the VTuber Industry: Looking to the Future with COVER CFO Yosuke Kaneko
item.author: cover_hirata
item.content:encoded: I grew up with anime and games since childhood, and I have always been fond of such culture. My father was an art dealer, and that gave me a lot of exposure to contemporary and other types of art. So from an early age I developed a strong interest in art and creativity. When I think about it, there may be a sense in which I perceive entertainment, such as games and anime, in an artistic way.When I was working in the London branch of a securities firm around 2018, I watched quite a lot of YouTube in my free time and was quite interested in the trends in VTuber culture. In those days, the popularity of Japanese manga, anime, and Vocaloid culture was gradually spreading throughout London. Later, the under the pandemic lockdown, anime and internet culture became popular with mass audiences through Netflix and other media. I was in London at a time when such Japanese culture was becoming mainstream, and I was also keeping a close watch on the new VTuber culture that was emerging from Japan and gaining momentum.Also, from my perspective as a consumer, I was struck by the uniqueness and novelty of VTubers‚Äô creativity. At the time, I was witnessing the birth of various start-ups in Japan and abroad, creating new value in the world. I felt that VTubers had great potential to create a new industry by utilizing the uniqueness of Japan.After that, the stimulus for my joining COVER was applying for the position of international business development manager. When I had the opportunity to speak with Tanigo during that process, I shared my thoughts on how to achieve sustainable business expansion and growth. COVER in 2021 had more than 100 employees and was preparing to relocate its office. Amid the rapid and intense expansion of COVER and its customer base, it was decided that I would officially join the team upon completing my assignment in London. In February, I began working as the GM of the Corporate Planning Office. Back then, I worked in business planning in a newly established department and later was appointed CFO.

item.title: ANYCOLOR‚Äôs Q3 Report: Record Growth in Livestreaming and Commerce
item.author: Thomas Toblu
item.content:encoded: ANYCOLOR, the powerhouse behind the beloved Nijisanji project, is once again making headlines. Their latest quarterly report for FY2025 Q3 reveals record-breaking performance. It also outlines a strategic vision that promises even more growth in the coming years. This article will break down the key highlights of the report. In this in-depth article, we‚Äôll explore the major segments of ANYCOLOR‚Äôs business‚Äîfrom livestreaming and commerce to events and promotions. Read also: Cover‚Äôs latest financial report!To summarize the key points from ANYCOLOR‚Äôs FY2025 Q3 report: Total revenue surged to 11,564 million JPY, driven largely by robust performance in commerce and live events. The livestreaming segment remains the backbone of ANYCOLOR‚Äôs revenue, providing consistent income and deep community engagement. Overcoming previous challenges, the commerce segment set new sales records with impressive order backlogs. Domestic live events broke records, underlining the continued appetite for immersive, in-person experiences.Critical Challenges for Nijisanji English: Unlike its domestic counterpart, NijiEN is facing declining revenue. There are fewer live events. Viewership is dwindling. These issues signal the need for a strategic overhaul. ANYCOLOR‚Äôs ambitious targets aim for increased revenue and profit. The company is making heavy investments in technology and talent. These actions position the company for a bright future, despite current challenges. Operational risks and market dynamics present challenges. However, ANYCOLOR‚Äôs diversified approach offers significant opportunities. Their commitment to innovation also creates opportunities.Key Financial Highlights: What‚Äôs New in Q3?ANYCOLOR‚Äôs FY2025 Q3 report is packed with numbers, but here are the standout points in plain language:The company posted a total revenue of 11,564 million JPY for the quarter. This marks an impressive year-over-year increase of nearly 50%. This boost is a testament to the company‚Äôs growing fan engagement and its ability to monetize its diverse offerings.ANYCOLOR operates several core business segments: This segment saw steady growth. It‚Äôs driven by the subscription and membership model that many VTubers use, ensuring a consistent revenue stream. The commerce segment comprises merchandise sales, digital content, and other online transactions. It experienced a remarkable jump of over 66% compared to the previous year. Record sales figures and an impressive order backlog point to a surge in fan spending. ANYCOLOR‚Äôs live events are a huge hit with fans. The event-related revenue increased by nearly 93%. Events such as music festivals and countdown shows are especially popular. The promotional side of the business also performed strongly, supporting brand awareness and cross-channel marketing strategies.Alongside revenue growth, ANYCOLOR saw its operating profit increase by 64.3% to 4,204 million JPY. Net income also shot up by nearly 64%. This indicates effective cost management by the company. At the same time, it is expanding its revenue base.These numbers highlight ANYCOLOR‚Äôs robust performance in Q3. They also suggest a solid foundation for future growth. This is especially true as the digital entertainment landscape continues to evolve.Livestreaming: The Heartbeat of the VTuber WorldFor many fans, the magic of VTubers comes alive during live streaming sessions. ANYCOLOR‚Äôs livestreaming segment remains a key pillar of its business model. Here‚Äôs why:Steady and Reliable Revenue:Livestreaming uses a membership-driven model. Fans subscribe to get exclusive content, perks, and closer interaction with their favorite VTubers. In Q3, livestreaming revenue reached 1,301 million JPY‚Äîa modest but steady increase from the previous year.Live streams are more than just a revenue stream‚Äîthey‚Äôre a way for fans to build community. Livestreaming offers interactivity and real-time connection. These aspects help solidify fan loyalty. As a result, other revenue streams like merchandise sales and event participation are driven.Ad Revenue and Sponsorships:Beyond memberships, livestreaming brings in ad revenue and sponsorship deals. ANYCOLOR‚Äôs ability to maintain a strong viewer base ensures that these revenue streams remain healthy.Overall, livestreaming is the heartbeat of ANYCOLOR‚Äôs VTuber ecosystem, providing both financial stability and a vibrant platform for fan interaction.ANYCOLOR‚Äôs commerce segment is where the company is truly breaking new ground. The revenue reached 7,204 million JPY in Q3. This is a staggering increase compared to previous periods. This segment is driving much of the overall growth. Let‚Äôs dive into what‚Äôs behind this success:Record Sales and Order Backlog:The report highlights that commerce revenue reached its highest-ever quarterly level. Large-scale initiatives and innovative marketing strategies led to sales figures that far exceeded targets. Fans have been enthusiastic about purchasing exclusive merchandise and digital content, resulting in a significant order backlog. This backlog even points to the fact that fans are eagerly waiting for new products and initiatives.Overcoming Operational Challenges:Previous quarters had been hampered by shipping delays, which negatively affected sales. However, in Q3, ANYCOLOR managed to clear these issues, ensuring that products reached fans in a timely manner. This operational improvement has been a major contributor to the record performance.The shift towards online commerce isn‚Äôt just about selling products‚Äîit‚Äôs about creating an engaging, seamless experience for fans. ANYCOLOR has invested in digital tools. They use e-commerce platforms that make it easier for fans to access exclusive content. They also help to access merchandise. This digital-first approach is crucial in today‚Äôs market, where convenience and speed are paramount.Impact on the Fan Community:For fans, buying merchandise is a way to show support. It also helps them connect with their favorite VTubers. The strong performance in commerce reflects not only effective sales strategies but also the deep engagement of ANYCOLOR‚Äôs fan base. Fans are willing to invest in the brand, whether it‚Äôs limited-edition items or exclusive digital content. That commitment is translating into impressive revenue figures.Event Success: Record-Breaking MilestonesLive events have always been a cornerstone of the VTuber experience. In Q3, ANYCOLOR‚Äôs event segment showed extraordinary growth:Massive Revenue Increase:Event revenue climbed to 1,428 million JPY. This is almost double compared to the previous year. ANYCOLOR‚Äôs live events are clearly resonating with fans. High-profile events such as music festivals and countdown shows have exceeded expectations, both in terms of attendance and sales.Fan Excitement and Community Building:Events create a unique atmosphere that blends live performance with digital interaction. They create a connection between the virtual and the real. Fans can experience the charisma and energy of their favorite VTubers in person or through high-quality digital streams. This immersive experience drives both ticket sales and ancillary revenues, such as exclusive event merchandise.The report notes that Q3 events were successful. This success occurred despite some cancellations and postponements earlier in the fiscal year. These events not only recovered lost ground, but also set new records. This demonstrates ANYCOLOR‚Äôs ability to adapt, plan, and execute large-scale events that meet‚Äîand even exceed‚Äîfan expectations.The Q4 outlook is equally promising, with planned events that are expected to generate even higher revenue. ANYCOLOR plans to continue its winning streak in live event production. They are implementing initiatives like ‚ÄúNIJISANJI FES 2025‚Äù. They are also collaborating with major venues like Tokyo Dome City.Promotion plays a crucial role in ANYCOLOR‚Äôs integrated strategy. Although the promotional segment saw a modest revenue increase in Q3 (1,618 million JPY), its importance should not be underestimated:Promotion is all about maintaining the brand‚Äôs presence and engaging with fans across multiple platforms. ANYCOLOR has successfully aligned its promotional activities with broader market trends. This alignment ensures that its VTubers remain relevant and visible.Supporting Other Segments:Effective promotion not only boosts direct revenue through sponsorships and ad deals. It also drives traffic to livestreams, commerce sites, and live events. In this way, promotional efforts serve as a critical support system for the entire business ecosystem.Strategic Resource Allocation:The report indicates that some VTuber resources were shifted to support major events. Despite this, the promotional segment has performed consistently. Maintaining this balance ensures immediate revenue spikes from some initiatives. Meanwhile, the overall brand remains strong and continually attracts new fans.A Critical Look at Nijisanji English (NijiEN)While ANYCOLOR‚Äôs domestic operations continue to thrive, the international arm‚ÄîNijisanji English (NijiEN)‚Äîis showing signs of strain. NijiEN faces several challenges. These could affect its long-term prospects, unlike the robust performance of its Japanese counterpart.The data suggests that NijiEN‚Äôs revenue has been on a downward trajectory. The international segment is an essential part of ANYCOLOR‚Äôs global strategy. However, it has not achieved the same financial momentum as the domestic division. The report indicates that NijiEN‚Äôs revenue, which once showed promise, is now experiencing a decline compared to previous quarters. This downturn is a significant concern. This is especially true because the international market is expected to be a major growth driver for the VTuber industry.The Vanishing Live EventsOne of the most glaring differences between NijiEN and its domestic counterpart is the lack of live events. The domestic group has continued to generate substantial revenue from live events. These include record-breaking shows and festivals. However, NijiEN has not maintained a consistent event schedule. In recent quarters, NijiEN has seen little to no investment in live events. This absence is critical. Live events are not only a major revenue source. They are also a key way to engage and expand the fan community. The lack of high-profile events is adding to NijiEN‚Äôs struggles. It may be a missed opportunity to tap into international enthusiasm for immersive experiences.Dwindling Viewership and EngagementAnother red flag for NijiEN is the noticeable decline in viewership numbers. In a space where active and engaged audiences are the lifeblood of success, dwindling viewership can have a severe impact. It creates a cascading effect on revenue streams. This ranges from livestreaming subscriptions to digital merchandise sales. Critics and industry insiders have noted that NijiEN‚Äôs viewership metrics have been slipping. Strategic Implications and the Need for a Course CorrectionThe challenges faced by Nijisanji English raise important questions about its current strategy. As ANYCOLOR continues to invest heavily in domestic operations with strong returns, NijiEN‚Äôs performance appears to lag behind. Relying solely on digital revenue streams may not be sufficient to sustain growth. Live events provide an energizing boost that is needed in a competitive international market.For NijiEN to turn the tide, a re-evaluation of its approach is necessary. This might include:Revamping Content Strategy: Developing fresh, engaging content that resonates with international audiences and combats the stagnation in viewership.Reintroducing Live Events: Investing in live or hybrid digital-physical events could reinvigorate the fan community. These events could drive up engagement and open up new revenue opportunities.Enhanced Marketing Efforts: Strengthening promotional campaigns targeted at global markets may help recapture lost viewers. These campaigns can also drive renewed interest in NijiEN‚Äôs offerings.Nijisanji English holds tremendous potential due to its international appeal. However, these current challenges suggest that ANYCOLOR needs to act swiftly. Failing to address declining revenue and engagement could undermine the segment‚Äôs long-term viability. It would also impact its role in ANYCOLOR‚Äôs global expansion strategy.The Future of their VTubers: ANYCOLOR‚Äôs Strategic VisionANYCOLOR‚Äôs FY2025 Q3 report isn‚Äôt just a snapshot of current performance‚Äîit‚Äôs a roadmap for their future. Here are some key strategic insights:Ambitious Growth Targets:ANYCOLOR aims to increase its sales by 88% and operating profit by 94% by FY2027. This ambitious target is supported by robust strategies. These strategies include expanding the VTuber roster by 10‚Äì15% per year. They also focus on increasing revenue per VTuber through enhanced support and targeted initiatives.Investment in Infrastructure and Technology:The company is investing heavily in upgrading its production studios. These upgrades include state-of-the-art motion capture and augmented reality (AR) facilities. These technological advancements are expected to boost the quality of VTuber content, providing fans with an even more immersive experience.Strengthening Talent Development:ANYCOLOR continues to invest in its Virtual Talent Academy (VTA). This program is designed to discover new VTuber talent. It also nurtures that talent. By ensuring a steady pipeline of fresh talent, the company secures new stars.
